title: Elemental Workshop I

properties.name: description
properties.value: Elemental Workshop I is a quest in which you find a mysterious book in Seers' Village, guiding you along the discovery of a lost magical mineral: the elemental ore.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Elemental Workshop I
This article is about the quest. For the dungeon, see Elemental Workshop (location).
 This quest has a quick guide found here.
It briefly summarises the steps needed to complete the quest.
Elemental Workshop I (#53)
Released 2 June 2004 (Update)
Members Yes
Quest series Elemental Workshop
Official difficulty Novice
Lead developer(s) Dylan C

Elemental Workshop I is a quest in which you find a mysterious book in Seers' Village, guiding you along the discovery of a lost magical mineral: the elemental ore.

Contents

  • 1 Details
  • 2 Walkthrough
    • 2.1 Bound under lock and key
    • 2.2 Restarting
    • 2.3 A lost art
  • 3 Rewards
  • 4 Required for completing
  • 5 Changes

Details[edit | edit source]

Start point Seers' Village, the house south-west of the bank.
Official difficultyNovice
DescriptionHundreds of years ago, a mineral was found that had the ability to change the property of Magic. The magicians, fearing the effect this may have on their profession, sealed this Workshop forever; or so they had hoped. See if you can rediscover the lost knowledge of elemental ore.
Official lengthShort
Requirements
  • 20 Mining (boostable)[t 1]
  • 20 Smithing (boostable)
  • 20 Crafting (boostable)
Items required
  • Knife or a non-poisoned slash weapon (e.g. dagger or scimitar)
  • Pickaxe
  • Needle (obtainable during the quest)
  • Thread
  • Leather (obtainable during the quest)
  • Hammer
  • 4 coal (4 more for each additional bar you would like to produce)
Recommended
  • 15 Combat level
  • Camelot teleport
  • Combat equipment for lower levels
Enemies to defeat
  • Earth elemental (level 35)
Ironman concerns
  • 30 Mining (boostable) (if mining the coal)

See if you can rediscover the lost knowledge of elemental ore.","difficulty":"Novice","kills":"* [[Earth elemental]] ''(level 35)''","name":"Elemental Workshop I","start":"[[Seers' Village]], the house south-west of the bank.","length":"Short","ironman":"* <span class=\"scp\" data-skill=\"Mining\" data-level=\"30\">[[File:Mining icon.png|21x21px|link=Mining|alt=Mining]] 30 [[Mining]]</span> <sup>(<span title=\"This requirement is boostable\" style=\"cursor:help; text-decoration: underline dotted;\">boostable</span>)</sup> (if mining the coal)","items":"* [[Knife]] or a non-poisoned [[slash weapon]] (e.g. [[dagger]] or [[scimitar]])\n* [[Pickaxe]]\n* [[Needle]] (obtainable during the quest)\n* [[Thread]]\n* [[Leather]] (obtainable during the quest)\n* [[Hammer]]\n* 4 [[coal]] (4 more for each additional bar you would like to produce)"}
  1. ^ This requirement can be bypassed if another player mines the rock.

Walkthrough[edit | edit source]

Bound under lock and key[edit | edit source]

Head to Seers' Village and into the house immediately south-west of the bank, indicated by the quest start icon. Search the bookcase on the east wall to receive a book titled The Elemental Shield.

The book speaks about an ore that was discovered in the Fifth Age, able to concentrate elemental energy into itself. Following this revelation, a workshop was created in Seers' Village, calling all craftsmen to invent new devices using this unique ore. Unfortunately, realising the destructive potential of the ore, the workshop had to be closed down, along with details of any processes involved destroyed.

The odd looking wall.

Read the book before using a bladed weapon like a scimitar, dagger or knife on it to get a battered key, turning the tome into a slashed book. Do not drop the slashed book. Enter the north building with the anvil icon, and use the key on the odd-looking wall with the strange crack. Climb down the stairs you find there to enter a workshop.

Restarting[edit | edit source]

A map of the dungeon.

First, head into the northern chamber. There are two water controls to the east and west of the water wheel. Turn the Eastern water control first to display green and then the Western water control so that it also displays green. Then pull the lever near the water wheel to jump-start it. The water wheel should now start spinning.

A player fixes the bellows.

If you do not already have leather and a needle: The leather can be found in a crate in the north-western part of the central room, while the needle may be found in a stacked crate in the western room. Next, head into the eastern chamber. Fix the bellows with a spool of thread and leather, then pull the lever next to it. The bellows should now start pumping air.

Head into the western cavern and attempt to mine an elemental rock. The rock springs to life, yells, and attacks you. Kill the earth elemental, and pick up the elemental ore that it drops. Kill two more if you want to save time for Elemental Workshop II, or three more if you also want a Mind shield after completing that quest. Earth elementals only drop ores when awoken by an attempt to mine them.

Note: One of the Kandarin easy tasks is to kill one of each elemental (must kill a regular Earth elemental, not the ones that can be mined first) but it is entirely optional for this quest.

A player filling a stone bowl with lava.

Finally, head back to the central chamber. Search the small boxes north-east of the hatch to obtain a stone bowl. Fill it with lava from the lava trough in the southern chamber, then use it on the furnace to the east in the same chamber. The inside of the furnace should now glow orange. Note that this furnace DOES NOT operate as a regular furnace - it can only be used to smelt elemental bars.

A lost art[edit | edit source]

Proceed to use the elemental ore, along with four coal, on the furnace to obtain an elemental metal. If you receive the message "The furnace needs to be hotter in order to be of any use," return to the northern and eastern rooms to ensure that the water wheel is spinning and the bellow is moving.

With the slashed book in your inventory, go back to the centre and use the elemental metal on the workbench to make an elemental shield. If you are unable to craft the shield, destroy the slashed book and obtain a new one from the bookcase.

Note: You may make as many shields as you want so long as you return with the battered key, slashed book and 4 coal to smelt with the elemental ore. The elemental shield CAN be sold on the grand exchange for 1,683 gold.

Congratulations, quest complete!

Rewards[edit | edit source]

  • 1 Quest point
  • 5,000 Crafting experience
  • 5,000 Smithing experience
  • Access to the Elemental Workshop
  • An elemental shield, as well as the ability to make and wield them.

Required for completing[edit | edit source]

Completion of Elemental Workshop I is required for the following:

  • Elemental Workshop II (Quick guide)
  • An easy and medium task in the Kandarin Diary
Note: You may want to defeat one of each of the four Elementals for a Kandarin Diary requirement. For the Earth Elemental, you must defeat one of the actual Elementals walking around; the rock that turns into the Elemental won't count towards the requirement.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
2 October 2006
(update)

The quest was renamed from "Elemental Workshop" to "Elemental Workshop I".

v • d • e
Elemental Workshop I

  • Elemental metal
  • Elemental shield
  • Rock
Locations and scenery
  • Elemental Workshop
  • Odd looking wall
  • Water controls
  • Water wheel
  • Bellows

Music

Related

  • Elemental Workshop II

'''Elemental Workshop I''' is a [[quest]] in which you find a mysterious book in [[Seers' Village]], guiding you along the discovery of a lost magical mineral: the elemental ore.

==Details==
{{Quest details
|start = [[Seers' Village]], the house south-west of the bank.
|difficulty = 1
|description = Hundreds of years ago, a mineral was found that had the ability to change the property of Magic.

The magicians, fearing the effect this may have on their profession, sealed this Workshop forever; or so they had hoped. See if you can rediscover the lost knowledge of elemental ore.
|length = Short
|requirements = 
* {{SCP|Mining|20|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}}{{Refn|This requirement can be bypassed if another player mines the rock.|group=t}}
* {{SCP|Smithing|20|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}}
* {{SCP|Crafting|20|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}}
|items = 
* [[Knife]] or a non-poisoned [[slash weapon]] (e.g. [[dagger]] or [[scimitar]])
* [[Pickaxe]]
* [[Needle]] (obtainable during the quest)
* [[Thread]]
* [[Leather]] (obtainable during the quest)
* [[Hammer]]
* 4 [[coal]] (4 more for each additional bar you would like to produce)
|recommended = 
* {{SCP|Combat|15|link=yes}}
* [[Camelot teleport]]
* Combat equipment for lower levels
|kills = 
* [[Earth elemental]] ''(level 35)''
|ironman = 
* {{SCP|Mining|30|link=yes}} {{Boostable|yes}} (if mining the coal)
}}
{{Reflist|group=t}}

==Walkthrough==
===Bound under lock and key===
Head to [[Seers' Village]] and into the house immediately south-west of the bank, indicated by the quest start icon. Search the bookcase on the east wall to receive a book titled [[Battered book|The Elemental Shield]].

The book speaks about an ore that was discovered in the [[Fifth Age]], able to concentrate elemental energy into itself. Following this revelation, a workshop was created in Seers' Village, calling all craftsmen to invent new devices using this unique ore. Unfortunately, realising the destructive potential of the ore, the workshop had to be closed down, along with details of any processes involved destroyed.
[[File:Elemental Workshop I - Odd looking wall.png|thumb|220px|The odd looking wall.]]
Read the book before using a bladed weapon like a scimitar, dagger or knife on it to get a [[battered key]], turning the tome into a [[slashed book]]. Do not drop the slashed book. Enter the north building with the anvil icon, and use the key on the odd-looking wall with the strange crack. Climb down the stairs you find there to enter a [[Elemental Workshop (location)|workshop]].

===Restarting===
[[File:Elemental Workshop (location) map.png|thumb|left|200px|A map of the [[Elemental Workshop (location)|dungeon]].]]
First, head into the northern chamber. There are two water controls to the east and west of the water wheel. Turn the Eastern water control first to display green and then the Western water control so that it also displays green. Then pull the lever near the water wheel to jump-start it. The water wheel should now start spinning.
[[File:Elemental Workshop I - Fixing bellows.png|thumb|220px|A player fixes the bellows.]]
If you do not already have leather and a needle: The leather can be found in a crate in the north-western part of the central room, while the needle may be found in a stacked crate in the western room. Next, head into the eastern chamber. Fix the bellows with a spool of thread and leather, then pull the lever next to it. The bellows should now start pumping air. 

Head into the western cavern and attempt to mine an elemental rock. The rock springs to life, yells, and attacks you. Kill the [[earth elemental]], and pick up the [[elemental ore]] that it drops. Kill two more if you want to save time for [[Elemental Workshop II]], or three more if you also want a [[Mind shield]] after completing that quest. '''Earth elementals only drop ores when awoken by an attempt to mine them.'''

'''Note:''' One of the [[Easy Kandarin Diary|Kandarin easy]] tasks is to kill one of each elemental (must kill a regular Earth elemental, not the ones that can be mined first) but it is entirely optional for this quest.
[[File:Elemental Workshop I - Filling a stone bowl.png|thumb|220px|A player filling a stone bowl with lava.]]
Finally, head back to the central chamber. Search the small boxes north-east of the hatch to obtain [[a stone bowl]]. Fill it with lava from the lava trough in the southern chamber, then use it on the [[furnace]] to the east in the same chamber. The inside of the furnace should now glow orange. Note that this furnace '''DOES NOT''' operate as a regular furnace - it can only be used to smelt elemental bars.

===A lost art===
Proceed to use the elemental ore, along with four [[coal]], on the furnace to obtain an [[elemental metal]]. If you receive the message "''The furnace needs to be hotter in order to be of any use,"'' return to the northern and eastern rooms to ensure that the water wheel is spinning and the bellow is moving.

With the [[slashed book]] in your inventory, go back to the centre and use the elemental metal on the workbench to make an [[elemental shield]]. If you are unable to craft the shield, destroy the slashed book and obtain a new one from the bookcase.

Note: You may make as many shields as you want so long as you return with the battered key, slashed book and 4 coal to smelt with the elemental ore. The elemental shield CAN be sold on the grand exchange for {{Coins|{{GEP|Elemental shield}}}} gold.

'''Congratulations, quest complete!'''

==Rewards==
{{Quest rewards
|name = Elemental Workshop I
|image = [[File:Elemental Workshop I reward scroll.png|centre]]
|qp = 1
|rewards =
*{{SCP|Crafting|5,000}} [[Crafting]] experience
*{{SCP|Smithing|5,000}} [[Smithing]] experience
*Access to the [[Elemental Workshop (location)|Elemental Workshop]]
*An [[elemental shield]], as well as the ability to make and wield them.
}}

==Required for completing==
Completion of Elemental Workshop I is required for the following:
*[[Elemental Workshop II]] <sup>[[Elemental Workshop II/Quick guide|(Quick guide)]]</sup>
*An easy and medium task in the [[Kandarin Diary]]
:'''Note:''' You may want to defeat one of each of the four Elementals for a Kandarin Diary requirement. For the Earth Elemental, you must defeat one of the actual Elementals walking around; the rock that turns into the Elemental won't count towards the requirement.
